Hatta Rajasa Borong Pisang di Pinggir Jalan Demi Cucu Tercinta
07 Nov 2019, 08:34 by Devi Setya - detikFood


Foto: instagram @ruby_26

Jakarta - Hatta Rajasa terlihat memborong pisang di pinggir jalan karena sang cucu minta dibelikan pisang. Ia pun turun dari mobil dan membeli setandan pisang untuk cucu tercinta. Kisah sederhana ini dibagikan Siti Ruby Aliya Rajasa, putri Hatta Rajasa yang juga istri dari Ibas Yudhoyono. Hatta Rajasa, Aliya dan Gayartri diketahui pergi berkendara bersama tapi di jalan, Gayatri melihat penjual pisang dan memaksa ingin dibelikan pisang. "Sebelum masuk mobil Gaia melihat deretan penjual pisang dan minta (maksa) utk dibelikan. Untung Grandpa lihat dan langsung menghampiri serta membelikan. terima kasih Pepa!" tulis Aliya pada unggahan di instagramnya @ruby_26.


Foto: instagram @ruby_26

Baca juga : Mengintip Gaya Makan Aliya Rajasa, Menantu SBY yang EleganAliya juga membagikan foto saat sang ayah memilih dan membeli pisang kesukaan Gayatri. Setandan pisang dipilih langsung oleh si kecil yang digendong Aliya. Hatta Rajasa pun langsung membayarnya pada sang penjual. Ternyata pisang jadi salah satu makanan favorit Gayatri, terang saja ia memaksa dibelikan pisang meskipun sedang ada di pinggir jalan. "Nah pisang yg Gaia pilih ini enaknya dijadikan pisang goreng. siapa di sini kayak baby G suka pisang goreng? Enaknyaa disantap sore ini yaa sambil tea atau coffee time," ujar Aliya. Ternyata kecil-kecil, Gayatri suka makan pisang goreng. Unggahan Aliya ini pun memancing banyak komentar netizen yang sama-sama doyan makan pisang goreng. Ada juga yang memuji kesederhanaan keluarga ini yang mau membeli buah lokal langsung di pinggir jalan.


Foto: instagram @ruby_26

"Pisang ketan namanya. selain jadi pisang goreng di kolak juga enak, kancing kandang yg pisang di campur dengan parutan kelapa pisang di tumbuk dan kasih sedikit tepung singkong," komentar netizen seraya menjabarkan jenis pisang yang dibeli Hatta Rajasa."Hhahaha kk lucu captionnya, emang bener yah kakek/nenek tuh ga pernah bisa nolak permintaan cucunya," kata netizen lain.Unggahan foto ini lantas mendapat lebih dari 30 ribu likes dan ribuan komentar. Hatta Rajasa Borong Bananas on the Side of the Road for the Sake of a Loving Grandson
Nov 7 2019, 08:34 by Devi Setya - detikFood


Photo: instagram @ ruby_26

Jakarta - Hatta Rajasa was seen buying up bananas on the side of the road because his grandchild asked to buy bananas. He got out of the car and bought a bunch of bananas for his beloved grandchild. This simple story was shared by Siti Ruby Aliya Rajasa, daughter of Hatta Rajasa who is also the wife of Ibas Yudhoyono. Hatta Rajasa, Aliya and Gayartri were known to drive together but on the road, Gayatri saw a banana seller and insisted on buying a banana. "Before getting in Gaia's car, she saw a row of banana sellers and asked (to be forced) to be bought. Luckily Grandpa saw and immediately approached and bought. Thank you, Pepa!" Aliya wrote to the upload on his @ ruby_26 Instagram.


Photo: instagram @ ruby_26

Also read: Peek at Aliya Rajasa's Eating Style, SBY's Elegant Daughter-in-law Alliya also shared photos when his father chose and bought Gayatri's favorite banana. A bunch of bananas are chosen directly by the child held by Aliya. Hatta Rajasa paid directly to the seller. It turns out that bananas are one of Gayatri's favorite foods, obviously he insists on buying bananas even though they are on the roadside. "Well, the banana that Gaia chose is delicious to make fried bananas. Who here like baby G likes fried bananas? It's delicious to eat this afternoon, while having tea or coffee time," Aliya said. Apparently small, Gayatri likes to eat fried bananas. Aliya's upload also provoked a lot of comments from netizens who are both fond of eating fried bananas. There are also those who praise the simplicity of this family who want to buy local fruit directly on the roadside.


Photo: instagram @ ruby_26

"Sticky bananas are named. Besides being fried bananas in compote it is also delicious, buttoned banana cages mixed with grated coconut bananas in mashed and give a little cassava flour," commented netizens while describing the type of bananas purchased by Hatta Rajasa. Really, grandfather / grandmother can never refuse his grandchild's request, "said another netizen. This photo upload then got more than 30 thousand likes and thousands of comments.
